Honestly, this game is terrible. 
I'd bracket it within the category of games that ninety-nine percent of the time are more frustrating/anguishing then actually, well.... fun. Why waste all of your time rubbing elbows with the septic tank of a community this game has while you try your hardest to make entertainment out of the imbalanced mess that it practically makes a spectacle out of, when you could be playing some other game that doesn't sap the joy out of your soul. Personally it was only popular for me for as long as it was because nothing else can emulate its particular style and  the formula was new to anything else i've played, and its resonance in scary slasher movie pop-culture which is personally an interest of mine. 
Every new update though lately it's been some new disaster; seriously at times it feels like the developers don't even have a sense of what their own game is like or how it's played. Battling game imbalance, items/add-ons that by any other game's perspective would be considered downright unfair and toxic, I.E., instant kill toolkits and 'easy win' copout items ( that exist because I don't know really, they just make it less fun and ruin the game by my understanding ), whole new goodie bags of bugs and gamebreaking glitches with practically every major/minor hotfix or content update, a community of people that are always frustrated by percieved unfairnesses, other people not playing by their expectations and established 'honor systems' of playing that everybody's supposed to abide by to compensate on the player's end for shitty mechanics like hook camping that ruin the game, that take it out on their teammates/opponents via totally unsolicited shitty language and insults that make you wish there was any way you could play this game by yourself, grindy luck-based loadout system, matchmaking that pits players of huge disparaging ranks against eachother in naturally rigged games by skilllevel (a new recent problem), the list goes on, and on.... 

Just skip it. You'd be doing yourself a favor. Lately it's been gearing in to PayDay 2 levels of downloadable content anyway, that include perks and item/add-on/character advantages practically essential for being tenable at any kind of higher rank play, locked behind paywalls, so it's not worth the silly amount of money you'd have to spend to have everything in the first place.

Great concept but flawed with a fractured community. There are a lot of mechanics that are exploitable and push the community to work towards meta elements that can be unforgiving to new players. While there is a toxic element to the community as many other reviewers have mentioned, there are nuances that take different sides, seemingly feeding off one another. All going back to the flawed/exploitable mechanics and the designer's nightmare that is balance. I don't envy the developers on the struggle to get that mess right and wonder if maybe they should start exploring ideas for a sequel that fixes things from the ground up, if they haven't already started jotting down notes.

 I should probably also mention the latency problems and constant connection drops. People will often disconnect to escape the negative effects of getting killed (eg: losing equipment) but latency has plagued the game for quite a while and people will lose connection or be unable to play the game properly either because of high ping or desynch. It really doesn't matter if you're on a fiber optic if the netcode has problems.

I know a lot of my friends own this game and like it. I played a good amount of it early in its release, so I can't say what exactly has been changed. There are other mid-2010s bargain development-esque games on Steam like this that aren't given a second look, so I don't really understand why it's so popular. I think the developers are on record saying they didn't expect it either. I suppose it hits people on some primal predator/prey thrill level.

Dead by Daylight in a nutshell is a generator repair simulator, while a killer hunts you and three other survivors down. Or, you play as the killer. That's the whole game on repeat. You have very few options when it comes to escaping a killer once they set their focus on you. You need to hope you get lucky when you drop a pallet to hit the killer, and even if you do, after that you need to get lucky running away because you light up a trail like a Christmas tree. Whether or not other survivors play as teammates is up to each individual player. Many will leave you hanging regardless of whether you saved them or not. Some killers have overpowered abilities which allow them to knock you down in one hit, however the addition of hex totems allows players to disable those abilities, if you can find them. On occasion, killers will hook you and face camp or perimeter camp you until you die, if only just to troll. This game also has ludicrous amounts of DLC, so it has pay-to-win characters and abilities.

The issues with overpowered abilities, the community being toxic, and progression being way too slow seem to have been taken care of for the most part. It can be fun, but overall, it's still a generator repair simulator, and they just keep adding more and more ways to get your money.

fun game with huge skill gap at start but you learn pretty fast.

1) Aparecer
2) Ponerse a reparar
3) Escuchar el asesino soplandote el cuello
4) Ser colgado
5) Ser campeado
6) Ser liberado
7) Ser tuneleado
8) Morir y perder rango
9) Empezar una partida como asesino
10) Te toca con un cristiano que corre como Usain Bolt y esquiva como Messi
11) Te hacen todos los generadores en 3 minutos
12) Se escapan todos
13) Cerrar el juego
14) Repetir 1) al otro dia

Noice

While yes, this game can be difficult, it's also very fun to play with friends or even with people watching! My family likes to watch me play it. And I have many memories of when I first started playing on PS4 with some old friends of mine. It quickly overshadowed Overwatch and other games I used to play, it's become a favorite alongside one other. I remember watching the live stream of the Plague and Jane Romero, I was excited to say the least! I hope people find joy in this game like I did, it's fantastic and sometimes it makes you work hard, but the memes and memories make it worth it.
